==Description==
Unvalidated redirection vulnerabilities allow attackers to craft URLs that appear to lead to a legitimate site, but actually lead to a malicious site. An attacker may be able to leverage this vulnerability to trick users into entering sensitive information into a malicious website while seemingly navigating within a trusted website.
==Countermeasures==
The following TeamMentor articles describe effective counter-measures against unvalidated redirection vulnerabilities:
* [[97c6549f-abb4-41fe-ac16-b394e4ac4b16|Don't Use Redirects Or Forwards If Possible]] * [[e4f51a77-5401-4aec-8c64-4198b2718b8d|Calculate Destinations of Redirects And Forwards Without User Input]] * [[2869a8f0-93b8-4689-b531-d59367988a33|Use Mapping Values When Redirecting on User Input]] * [[52982908-b692-41bc-afb1-8663e399c51c|Validate Destinations of Redirects And Forwards]]
==Checklists==
The following checklist items can help make sure that effective counter-measures against unvalidated redirection vulnerabilities have been implemented:
* [[9d028dc7-5faf-48d6-b445-2afed87b8394|Redirects And Forwards Are Not Used Unless Necessary]] * [[ec9ba67e-9ff1-41b2-a346-1ca4b30a3479|Destinations of Redirects And Forwards Are Calculated Without User Input]] * [[13912b44-0b4e-4792-a649-ee6bc16a3ede|Mapping Values Are Used for Redirects And Forwards]] * [[ec9ba67e-9ff1-41b2-a346-1ca4b30a3479|Destinations of Redirects And Forwards Are Validated]]
==Additional Resources==
* For more information about unvalidated redirection, please see https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10_2010-A10-Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards
